title: Mean Value Theorem
description: If f is continuous on [a,b] and differentiable on (a,b), there exists c where f'(c) = (f(b)-f(a))/(b-a).

overview.historicalContext: Proved by Lagrange in 1797. Foundation for L'Hopital's rule and Taylor's theorem.
overview.problemStatement:
**Mean Value Theorem**:

$$f'(c) = \frac{f(b) - f(a)}{b - a}$$

for some c âˆˆ (a, b).
overview.proofStrategy: Apply Rolle's theorem to g(x) = f(x) - f(a) - [(f(b)-f(a))/(b-a)](x-a).

conclusion.summary: The Mean Value Theorem is verified with both classical and HasDerivAt formulations.
